intro: Bartonia texana, commonly known as Texas bartronia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in open woods and along stream banks, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in suitable climates.
